questions.question: ........................... is the longest river in the world.
questions.description: We use the article 'the' before the names of rivers, mountains etc.

questions.question: ............................ is one of the largest lakes in Africa.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with lakes.

questions.question: ......................... is the highest peak in the world.
questions.description: Articles are not normally used with the names single mountains.

questions.question: .......................... are an example of a folded mountain range.
questions.description: The article 'the' is used with the names of mountain groups.

questions.question: .......................... is the largest desert in the world.
questions.description: The article 'the' is used with the names of deserts.

questions.question: He was my classmate at .......................................
questions.description: 'The' is not normally used in the titles of major universities and principal public buildings.

questions.question: We are going to ........................ for summer.
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of countries.

questions.question: Mandarin is the official language of .............................................
questions.description: Countries whose names contain common nouns like state, union or republic usually take the article 'the'.

questions.question: London is on ............................
questions.description: We use 'the' with the names of rivers.

questions.question: .......................... attracts thousands of visitors each day.
questions.description: We use 'the' with the names of most museums and art galleries.

questions.question: His brother lives in ..........................
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of continents, countries, states, counties etc.

questions.question: ......................... is the largest continent in the world.
questions.description: We do not use articles with the names of continents.
